bestBHT.bht: Why worry about the things that are necessary for sustaining and prolonging life? Corroding solicitude will not bring you the least of the things ye fret about but may double the evil of wanting them. The original meaning of the word is time of life, age. Moreover, Christ is speaking of food and clothing, the object of which is to foster and prolong life. Just as you cannot add even the slightest measurement to your own stature, worrying will not add anything to your life. Trust in God's timing and care.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Corroding solicitude will not bring you the least of the things ye fret about.
Though it may double the evil of wanting them.
Why vex yourselves about things of more consequence?
Marvin Vincent: The original meaning of the word is time of life, age."
But both the usage and the connection are in favor of the meaning age."
Moreover, Christ is speaking of food and clothing, the object of which is to foster and prolong life.
Archibald T. Robertson: A cubit (πηχυν). Matthew 6:27 has πηχυν ενα (one cubit, though ενα is sometimes merely the indefinite article.
Stature (ηλικιαν) as in Matthew, which see.
John Gill: In an anxious and distressing manner, for food and raiment, in order to preserve and continue life."
Add to his stature one cubit?
It seems rather to regard the age of a man, and the continuance of his life.
John Wesley: Which of you can add the least measure...
To add one cubit to a thing (which is the phrase in the original)...
...was a kind of proverbial expression for making the least addition to it.

bhtAttempts.bht: Why worry about the things that are necessary for sustaining and prolonging life? Bothersome anxiety will not provide the things that you are concerned about, in fact, it may only worsen the effects of lacking them. Instead of needlessly vexing yourselves about things of greater significance, focus on the present moment and trust in God's provision. Remember, the term used here can be understood as age, emphasizing the importance of the duration and preservation of life. Just as you cannot add even the slightest measurement to your own stature, worrying will not add anything to your life. Trust in God's timing and care.

Why worry about the things necessary for sustaining life? Anxious thoughts won't bring what you fret about, but may even worsen the effects of lacking them. Instead, focus on the present moment and trust in God's provision. The term used can be understood as age, emphasizing the preservation of life. Just as you can't add to your stature, worrying won't add anything to your life. Trust in God's timing and care.

Why vex yourselves about things of more consequence? Corroding solicitude will not bring you the least of the things ye fret about, but may double the evil of wanting them. The object of food and clothing is to foster and prolong life, so why worry? Just as you cannot add even the least measure to your stature, worrying will not add anything to your life. Trust in God's timing and care.

Why vex yourselves about things of more consequence? Corroding solicitude will not bring you the least of the things ye fret about, but may double the evil of wanting them. The original meaning of the word is time of life, age. But both the usage and the connection are in favor of the meaning age. Moreover, Christ is speaking of food and clothing, the object of which is to foster and prolong life. Just as you cannot add even the slightest measurement to your own stature, worrying will not add anything to your life. Trust in God's timing and care.

Moreover, Christ is speaking of food and clothing, the object of which is to foster and prolong life. Just as you cannot add even the slightest measurement to your own stature, worrying will not add anything to your life. Trust in God's timing and care.
